result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony R. Sackett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony R. Sackett is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony R. Sackett was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Anthony R. Sackett was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Anthony R. Sackett was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony R. Sackett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per e-mail with Atty Bennett he is withdrawing his motion to withdraw as counsel.
for modifiction to conditions of probation - 15 days jail - Granted by Court

3:05 p.m. Defendant Anthony R. Sackett in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15tr2496, 15tr2419, 15cm369 and 16cm37. Schiek recites agreement. In 15cm369 - State moves to dismiss Counts 2, 4 and 6 - Granted. In 16cm37 - State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 3 and 4 - Granted; State moves to amend Count 2 to ordinance possession of drug paraphernalia - Granted. In 15tr2407 - State moves to dismiss - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest pleas.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Bennett/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
In 15tr2419
Fine - $762.00 plus blood draw surcharge
Driver's license revocation - 6 months
AODA assessment
Driver's Safety plan

In 15cm369
Count 1 - Jail - 90 days with Huber for all purposes including purposes of treatment to commence on/before Friday, May 13, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 


Counts 3 and 5
WHS/POP - 24 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
No intoxicants; no taverns
DNA 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA assessment
No firearms
Jail credit - 2 days
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

In 16CM37
Fine - $263.50 including costs

Bennett moves to apply cash bond of $1,000 to 15tr2419 and refund balance and cash bond of $500  to posters - Court denies motion - Cash bond of $1500 (2 cases posted) to be applied to fines/court costs. 
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 3:30 p.m.

2:25 p.m. Defendant Anthony R. Sackett in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm369, 16cm37, 15tr2407 and 15tr2419. Bennett statement that defendant is engaged in meaningful treatment, offer has been made by State; Defendant would like additional time to continue treatment. Bennett anticipates resolution short of trial. Bail continued. Adj. 2:27 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:44 p.m. Defendant Anthony R. Sackett in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm369, 15tr2419, 15tr2407. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm. Adj. 2:45 p.m.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 2:57 p.m. Defendant Anthony R. Sackett in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm36915tr2419 and 15tr2407. In receipt of complaint.  Court states petition for court appointed attorney was received. Defendant states he did not qualify for PD - spoke with several private attorneys - Court denies petition for court appointed attorney. Bail continued  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
NO intoxicants; no taverns; no firearms

2:43 p.m. Defendant Anthony R. Sackett in court, in custody, via video.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint will be provided, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
